articles.title: Poll: Most feel democracy is threatened and political violence is a major problem - NPR
articles.description: 76% of Americans think that democracy is under a serious threat, according to the latest NPR/PBS News/Marist poll. And their faith in political leadership in the White House and Congress is low.
articles.content:
Ahead of the July Fourth holiday and the country's 249th birthday, three-quarters of Americans say democracy is under serious threat, according to a new NPR/PBS News/Marist poll.

articles.author: Sandee LaMotte, CNN
articles.title: Deaths from heart attacks are way down. Here's what's killing us instead - KSL News
articles.description: Heart disease is the leading cause of death around the world. However, overall heart disease death rates over the past five decades dropped by 66% in American adults age 25 and older, according to a new study.
